title: Eric Trump says 'We weren't smart enough to collude with Russia'
description: Eric Trump joked with former NFL quarterback Jay Cutler on his podcast 'Uncut' about the Trump administration and Russia saying, "we weren't smart enough to collude with Russia. We didn't know what the hell we were doing." Susan Page, Washington Bureau Chief at USA today and CNN's Ryan Lizza join New Day to discuss.

title: 'His shtick is getting rather old': UK Opposition MP on Boris Johnson controversies
description: UK Shadow Foreign Secretary David Lammy talks to Amanpour about Britain's Covid crisis and the controversies swirling around Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: McDonald's claws back $105 million from fired CEO Steve Easterbrook
description: McDonald's has settled a lawsuit with former CEO Steve Easterbrook, forcing the disgraced executive to repay his severance package of more than $100 million.

title: Kim Jong Un biographer discusses a regime 'based on lies'
description: Anna Fifield, author of "The Great Successor," says, after 10 years, Kim is often underestimated but faces massive stress from covid-related border closures

title: Drastic ecological changes in Africa could affect the entire planet. Here's why
description: Disruption of the world's second-largest rainforest is having dire consequences on the planet.  CNN's Zain Asher explains why greater demand for resources negatively impacts the Congo basin.

title: The first true millipede has been discovered. It has the most legs of any living creature on the planet
description: Scientists have discovered the first millipede that has more than 1,000 legs -- 1,306, to be precise.

title: Is Mitch McConnell in trouble?
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell is in a power struggle with former President Donald Trump over the control of the Republican Party... and McConnell is losing. In the latest episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza unpacks why Trump's endorsements are a must among GOP candidates -- and his ongoing feud with McConnell could be a threat to the Senator's quest to stay in leadership.

title: The dos and don'ts of creating the perfect nacho, according to John Berman
description: CNN anchor John Berman explains why he wants to create 'perfect nachos' and shares step-by-step instructions.

title: Security flaw could impact the entire internet
description: • Microsoft warns China, Iran, North Korea and Turkey are exploiting vulnerability

title: Bank of England hikes interest rates to tackle rising prices
Queen Elizabeth II cancels pre-Christmas family lunch
description: Queen Elizabeth II has canceled a pre-Christmas family lunch as a precaution because of a surge in Covid-19 cases in the United Kingdom, a source at Buckingham Palace told CNN on Thursday.

title: Claudette Colvin's juvenile record has been expunged, 66 years after she was arrested for refusing to give her bus seat to a White person
description: A request by Claudette Colvin, a civil rights pioneer who refused in 1955 to give up her seat to a White person on an Alabama bus, to seal, destroy and expunge her juvenile court records has been granted.

title: White House to announce new lead pipe and paint removal effort
description: Vice President Kamala Harris plans to announce a new administration push to eliminate lead from water pipes and homes during remarks Thursday in Washington, according to senior administration officials.

title: How the January 6 committee finally exposed Trump's empire of lies
Records fall and borders close as world races to get control of Omicron
Bank of England hikes interest rates to tackle rising prices
description: The Bank of England is hiking interest rates in an effort to fight surging consumer prices even as the Omicron variant engulfs the United Kingdom and threatens to put the economy into reverse.

title: Records fall and borders close as world races to get control of Omicron
description: • France shuts out UK tourists

title: Mercedes withdraws its appeal into chaotic F1 finale and congratulates Max Verstappen on first world title
description: Max Verstappen's first Formula One world title panned out "way more intense" than he could have imagined but the Red Bull driver can finally enjoy his victory after after Mercedes officially withdrew its appeal into how the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix finished.

title: Taniela Moa: Former Tonga rugby international dies aged 36
description: Former Tonga rugby international Taniela Moa has died at the age of 36, the Tongan Rugby Union announced on Thursday.

title: Music producer 'Flow La Movie' amongst nine people killed in private jet crash
description: Nine people were killed on Wednesday after a private aircraft crashed while making an emergency landing at Las Americas Airport in the Dominican Republic's capital Santo Domingo, according to the plane's operator, Helidosa Aviation Group.

title: Exclusive: 'Cyber is the most dangerous weapon in the world,' JPMorgan council warns
description: Business leaders and former policymakers are sounding the cyber alarm.

title: More hurricane-force wind gusts were reported across the US in a single day than ever before
description: A record-setting day of extreme weather struck a large portion of the US on Wednesday, with heavy winds barreling in from the Rockies to the Great Lakes and exacerbating fire conditions.

title: How to find the world's roomiest airplane seats
description: One of the greatest luxuries when we fly is space: the space to stretch out, relax, work and sleep while flying seven miles above the Earth at nearly the speed of sound.

title: Hundreds of dinosaur footprints uncovered in Poland
description: Hundreds of dinosaur footprints, so well-preserved that even the scaly skin can be seen, have been found in Poland, giving an insight into a complex ecosystem around 200 million years ago, geologists said.

title: France to ban plastic bottles in stadiums to protect players and staff
description: The sale and carrying of plastic bottles is to be banned in French stadiums from July 2022, the French government announced Thursday in a statement.

title: In a blow to Boeing, Qantas picks Airbus for its domestic fleet
description: Australia's Qantas is choosing Airbus over Boeing to replace its domestic fleet. The decision is a big blow to the American aircraft maker, and a major win for its European rival.

title: Watch: Wingsuit pilot becomes first person to fly in and out of 'Devil's House'
description: There are some people out there for who even the word 'daredevil' doesn't quite do justice to the mind-boggling feats they perform.

title: Black tech entrepreneurs struggle to find funding in Britain. Now they're looking abroad
description: Black tech entrepreneurs in the United Kingdom say they have to rely on foreign investors to get their businesses off the ground.

title: Grand jury recommends how to avert another disaster like the Surfside condo collapse
description: In a new report, a Miami-Dade grand jury overseeing the Surfside condo collapse offered a litany of recommendations to help avoid a similar event, including, most notably, that the county's 40-year recertification requirement be drastically changed.

title: School district will pay more than $26 million to Parkland shooting victims and families
description: The Broward County public school district will pay more than $26 million to the shooting victims and the families of 17 people killed at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

title: Judge under pressure to resign after home video with racist language surfaces
description: A judge in Lafayette, Louisiana, is taking a leave of absence and facing calls for her resignation after a video with racist language recorded at her home surfaced.

title: Four children dead and several injured after wind lifts bouncy castle into the air
description: Two children are dead and several are critically injured after they fell 32 feet (10 meters) from a bouncy castle lifted into the air by wind at a school event in Australia.

title: 'The Boss' may have just made a cool half-billion dollars
description: "The Boss" may have just made a cool half-billion dollars.

title: Top editor at nationalist Chinese state tabloid retires
description: The longtime editor of one of China's most outspoken and nationalistic state media outlets says he's stepping down.

title: From A to Z-endaya, 2021's best celebrity red carpet trends
description: After a year of awkwardly Zoomed-in awards show speeches and tie dye hoodies, it's been a relief to see stars returning to the red carpet. Glamour came back with a vengeance, filling our feeds with color, sparkle and flashes of nostalgia.

title: See what celebrities wore on the red carpet in 2021
description: After a year of lockdowns and remote celebrations, 2021 saw bold, joyful and glamorous looks return to the red carpet.

title: These are some of the Broadway shows canceled over Covid-19
description: Several Broadway shows were forced to cancel performances this week due to positive Covid-19 tests among the cast or crew, a setback for the industry that comes just months after it raised the curtain on an 18-month shutdown due to the pandemic.

title: Analysis: Why McConnell's comment about Jan. 6 panel matters
description: Mitch McConnell is the master of the "no comment."

title: Bali only received 45 international tourists in 2021 despite reopening
description: Destinations around the world have faced significant tourist reductions amid the coronavirus pandemic. But few have taken a harder hit than Bali, the Indonesian island long beloved of global travelers.

title: While there has been a steady accumulation of shocking evidence about January 6, recent days have laid bare the ex-President's own abuses of power
description: • Analysis: Why the Meadows criminal contempt move is so different

title: Chicago Blackhawks reach settlement with former player who said he was sexually assaulted by a coach in 2010
description: The Chicago Blackhawks and Kyle Beach, the professional hockey player who said he was sexually assaulted by a former Blackhawks video coach in 2010, have reached a settlement, according to a joint statement from the team and Beach's attorney.

title: Government reforms training at sea program after alleged rape of 19-year-old student
description: The federal government plans to begin sending students at the US Merchant Marine Academy back to sea later this month, resuming a key training program that had been temporarily suspended in the wake of an allegation that a 19-year-old student was raped on a ship.

title: 'With a side of regret': Michelin star restaurant gets terrible review
description: Meat out of an eyedropper! Michelin star Italian restaurant gets roasted in a hilarious review by an American travel blogger. Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Adorable baby sends brother off to college
description: Anderson learns about a baby who wanted to tell his brother how he felt when he left for college. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: Out of 27,000 hours underwater, dive team has spotted this fish only 9 times
description: A dive team with the Monterey Bay Aquarium captured video of a barreleye fish off the coast of California. Sightings of the transparent fish are rare, according to the team. Out of the 27-thousand hours they've spent under water, they've spotted the barreleye only nine times.

title: Apple is delaying its return to offices indefinitely and giving each employee $1,000
description: Apple will delay bringing its workers back to the office until a "yet to be determined" date, while giving all of its corporate and retail employees $1,000 to buy equipment for their home offices.
